metadata.synopsis: Dialogue with Halsin in the epilogue of Act 2. In it, he reacts to the various states that could occur in relation to his desire to rid the Act 2 region of the shadow curse:- if you've already done everything needed to ensure success. he's grateful and seeks to remain with you on the journey to Baldur's Gate.- if the curse is not yet sure to be lifted, but there's still something that can be done (ie Thaniel was saved from the Shadowfell, but hasn't been fully restored), he will implore the players to help and offer to join them.- if it's no longer possible to lift the curse, Halsin is sad and resigned to staying behind to stand sentry over it. He will not be available as a companion in Act 3, and his story effectively ends here.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Debug Book -> Set quest flags -> Act 2 -> SCE - Epilogue -> off path - > allow Halsin to appear -> Set up good path -> choose Halsin

12.speaker: Halsin
12.text: I swear I can already feel a change in the air - like the curse itself knows its time is short.
12.context: NodeContext: Content/savouring the moment - his mission has been a success

29.speaker: Halsin
29.text: You prevailed, my friend. Now your path takes you to Baldur's Gate... but I cannot join you.
29.context: NodeContext: Resigned/sad. It is now impossible for the Shadow Curse to be lifted

86.speaker: Halsin
86.text: Out there the curse still thrives. I failed this place - now I must remain behind, and stand watch over it.
86.context: NodeContext: Resigned/sad. It is now impossible for the Shadow Curse to be lifted

77.speaker: Player
77.text: You have to come - I need you.
77.context: NodeContext: Resigned/sad. It is now impossible for the Shadow Curse to be lifted

33.speaker: Halsin
33.text: This place needs me. I wish it were different - I truly do. As long as the curse remains, so must I.
33.context: NodeContext: Resigned/sad. It is now impossible for the Shadow Curse to be lifted

68.speaker: Player
68.context: NodeContext: Resigned/sad. It is now impossible for the Shadow Curse to be lifted

35.speaker: Halsin
35.text: This isn't what I wish. It's simply the way it has to be - I'm sorry.
35.context: NodeContext: Resigned/sad. It is now impossible for the Shadow Curse to be lifted

9.speaker: Player
9.text: The shadow curse was always your burden - not mine.
9.context: NodeContext: Resigned/sad. It is now impossible for the Shadow Curse to be lifted

43.speaker: Halsin
43.text: Yes, and so it must remain. I wish you success on your path. Had things been different, I might have walked it with you.
43.context: NodeContext: Resigned/sad. It is now impossible for the Shadow Curse to be lifted

80.speaker: Player
80.text: Perhaps we can still do something to lift the curse.
80.context: NodeContext: Resigned/sad. It is now impossible for the Shadow Curse to be lifted

4.speaker: Halsin
4.text: No. If you linger, you'll only jeopardise your own mission. This is my burden alone now until either the curse is lifted, or I breathe my last.
4.context: NodeContext: Resigned/sad. It is now impossible for the Shadow Curse to be lifted

46.speaker: Player
46.text: Share what you learned of Thaniel's presence in the Shadowfell.
46.context: NodeContext: Resigned/sad. It is now impossible for the Shadow Curse to be lifted

45.speaker: Halsin
45.text: Good - this is what we've been lacking. Now there's a chance we can find Thaniel, and bring him home.

61.speaker: Halsin
61.text: What comes next will prove dangerous. Meet me by the shore outside Last Light - we can do our work there without imperilling others.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: I found a Flaming Fist who escaped the Shadowfell - but he's dead.
30.context: NodeContext: Resigned/sad. It is now impossible for the Shadow Curse to be lifted

81.speaker: Halsin
81.text: Poor soul... but in truth, if I had to choose between death and the Shadowfell, I'd choose death.

60.speaker: Halsin
60.text: Perhaps there's still a way to learn something from him - the dead can't deny their knowledge, if asked the right question.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: I'm sorry things didn't turn out differently.
76.context: NodeContext: Resigned/sad. It is now impossible for the Shadow Curse to be lifted

67.speaker: Halsin
67.text: The same. I had hoped I might have been able to stay by your side, to help however I could. But the Oak Father has spoken - my place is here.
67.context: NodeContext: Resigned/sad. It is now impossible for the Shadow Curse to be lifted

31.speaker: Halsin
31.text: We need to find Oliver and get him to return to Thaniel. Otherwise this curse will never be lifted.
31.context: NodeContext: Urgent. The curse will not be lifted unless a spirit of the land is fully restored

38.speaker: Halsin
38.text: I will miss you, my friend. Perhaps our paths will cross again some day, if the sun ever shines on this place once more.
38.context: NodeContext: Resigned/sad. It is now impossible for the Shadow Curse to be lifted

47.speaker: Halsin
47.text: Thaniel still suffers. There'll be no improvement until his essence is restored, I fear.
47.context: NodeContext: Concerned/Urgent. The curse will not be lifted unless a spirit of the land is fully restored

62.speaker: Halsin
62.text: Thaniel rests well. He's healing very rapidly, now that Oliver has returned to him.
62.context: NodeContext: Content/savouring the moment - his mission has been a success

34.speaker: Player
34.context: NodeContext: Content/savouring the moment - his mission has been a success

53.speaker: Halsin
53.text: I knew I could put my faith in you. If only we had met sooner.
53.context: NodeContext: Content/savouring the moment - his mission has been a success

91.speaker: Player
91.text: So when will the curse actually be lifted?
91.context: NodeContext: Content/savouring the moment - his mission has been a success

18.speaker: Halsin
18.text: I can't say for certain, but we'll see it come to pass long before this place recedes behind us. Don't worry - all is at hand. We can depart whenever you're ready.
18.context: NodeContext: Content/savouring the moment - his mission has been a success

28.speaker: Player
28.text: What happened to Oliver, exactly? Did Thaniel... absorb him?

24.speaker: Halsin
24.text: No more than my right hand can absorb my left. Oliver is helping Thaniel to recover; they both lie dormant, like trees awaiting spring.

16.speaker: Halsin
16.text: Once the curse is lifted, they can stand as one or as a pair. Whatever they wish.

73.speaker: Halsin
73.text: I hope they will remain as a pair. It would be good for them both to have a friend, once I'm gone.
73.context: NodeContext: A little bittersweet. The kids are growing up.

13.speaker: Halsin
13.text: Still, I would like to return here some day. See Thaniel and Oliver again - in my meditations, or perhaps in person, if the Oak Father wills it. I hope he does.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: I hope you've no more requests - I need to take care of my own problems.

37.speaker: Halsin
37.text: No, my friend. The only thing I ask of you is to allow me by your side on the road ahead. I still owe you a debt, and I intend to pay.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: What now? You've got what you wanted, after all.
59.context: NodeContext: A little smoldering intensity/longing in the second line. Like he's seeing the player with new, romantic eyes.

89.speaker: Halsin
89.text: I have. But perhaps there is more that I want...
89.context: NodeContext: A little smoldering intensity/longing in the second line. Like he's seeing the player with new, romantic eyes.

83.speaker: Halsin
83.text: Anyway, once the curse is lifted, nature can take its course without me. I belong at your side.
83.context: NodeContext: His mission was a success, now he's forward-looking to the player's needs.

57.speaker: Player
57.context: NodeContext: Slight pause in the middle to correct his phrasing for any perceived innuendo

78.speaker: Halsin
78.text: And I'm glad to be had - glad to be with you, I mean.
78.context: NodeContext: Slight pause in the middle to correct his phrasing for any perceived innuendo

56.speaker: Player
56.text: This 'more' that you want. What is it?
56.context: NodeContext: Flirty. Enjoying the player's direct approach.

64.speaker: Halsin
64.text: Not what. Who. But all in due course.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: You flirting with me, big man? Why not spare the talk and get straight to the sweaty part?
39.context: NodeContext: Flirty. Enjoying the player's direct approach.

87.speaker: Halsin
87.text: You are not bound by social niceties, I see. I like that. Perhaps I can show you just how much, another time.
87.context: NodeContext: Flirty. Enjoying the player's direct approach.

55.speaker: Player
55.text: I need you to remain at camp for now.

88.speaker: Halsin
88.text: Thaniel rests still, but it's no easy slumber.
88.context: NodeContext: Concerned/Urgent. The curse will not be lifted unless a spirit of the land is fully restored

3.speaker: Halsin
3.text: The shadows rended him in two when they bore him away to the Shadowfell. Half of his essence remained here, amidst the curse.
3.context: NodeContext: Concerned/Urgent. The curse will not be lifted unless a spirit of the land is fully restored

42.speaker: Halsin
42.text: What stayed behind would have been the strongest part of him. But after all these years left in darkness, corruption must have taken hold.
42.context: NodeContext: Concerned/Urgent. The curse will not be lifted unless a spirit of the land is fully restored

6.speaker: Player
6.text: Tell me how I can help.
6.context: NodeContext: Concerned/Urgent. The curse will not be lifted unless a spirit of the land is fully restored

21.speaker: Halsin
21.text: It's both simple and not - we need to find Thaniel's missing half, and make him whole again.
21.context: NodeContext: Concerned/Urgent. The curse will not be lifted unless a spirit of the land is fully restored

72.speaker: Halsin
72.text: Only, the missing half may not come willingly. The curse will have sunk its tendrils deep, twisting Thaniel's essence into something... else.
72.context: NodeContext: Some foreboding. The curse will not be lifted unless a spirit of the land is fully restored

7.speaker: Player
7.text: All right, leave it to me.

41.speaker: Halsin
41.text: This doesn't have to be your burden alone. Every moment counts, and I've asked much of you already without being at your side.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: I'll see what I can do, but no promises.

26.speaker: Halsin
26.text: Let me help you then. Every moment counts, and I've asked much of you already without being at your side.

44.speaker: Halsin
44.text: If you want me, I'm yours. Against the curse, against the Absolute - anything. Just say the word.

70.speaker: Halsin
70.text: Seems your ranks are quite packed. If some space frees up, I'll be ready for you.

49.speaker: Halsin
49.text: Seems your ranks are quite packed. If some space frees up, I'll be ready for you.

84.speaker: Halsin
84.text: Good. Now our roots can deepen - together.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: Come with me. I might need you out there.

15.speaker: Halsin
15.text: Gladly. Let's put an end to this, once and for all.

69.speaker: Player
69.text: Any ideas on how to find this missing half?
69.context: NodeContext: Theorising/racking his brains.The curse will not be lifted unless a spirit of the land is fully restored

19.speaker: Halsin
19.text: No matter how it's been twisted by the shadows, it is still part of Thaniel's essence - it will resemble him somehow, and may show signs of his power.
19.context: NodeContext: Theorising/racking his brains.The curse will not be lifted unless a spirit of the land is fully restored

22.speaker: Halsin
22.text: Look for life in the darkness. Wildflowers, where everything else is dead. The curse cannot subdue the power Thaniel bears. Not entirely.
22.context: NodeContext: Theorising/racking his brains.The curse will not be lifted unless a spirit of the land is fully restored

8.speaker: Halsin
8.text: In fact, I saw just the sort before, not long after we first came within reach of the shadow curse. Fool that I am, I did not grasp their significance at the time.
8.context: NodeContext: Moment of realisation. Kicking himself a bit for not putting 2 + 2 together earlier

65.speaker: Halsin
65.text: There is a ruin, some way outside of Last Light. I caught a glimpse of fresh blooms there, but did not investigate further. I shall mark it upon your map.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: Once Thaniel's essence is found, what then?
0.context: NodeContext: Theorising/racking his brains.The curse will not be lifted unless a spirit of the land is fully restored

79.speaker: Halsin
79.text: In truth, I'm not sure. This is beyond all reckoning. It's still part of Thaniel, deep down, but it may not recognise that, or want to recognise that.
79.context: NodeContext: Theorising/racking his brains.The curse will not be lifted unless a spirit of the land is fully restored

17.speaker: Halsin
17.text: Perhaps it can be reasoned with, but I'm not hopeful. Reason is not something that thrives amidst the shadow curse.
17.context: NodeContext: Some foreboding.The curse will not be lifted unless a spirit of the land is fully restored

82.speaker: Player
82.text: I met a sort of shadow child before - a little boy named Oliver. Around Thaniel's age.
82.context: NodeContext: 'Could it be...?' Sounds like a promising lead in lifting the curse

58.speaker: Halsin
58.text: And you saw this boy yourself? That can't be a coincidence - but we need to be sure.
58.context: NodeContext: 'Could it be...?' Sounds like a promising lead in lifting the curse

71.speaker: Player
71.text: I met a shadow child named Oliver, resembling Thaniel - but he's dead now.
71.context: NodeContext: Intrigued/motivated. A chance to lift the curse might be at hand

48.speaker: Halsin
48.text: Perhaps not - if he truly is a part of Thaniel, then he is beyond life and death. More likely he's just hiding. We should return to where you saw him.
48.context: NodeContext: Intrigued/motivated. A chance to lift the curse might be at hand

54.speaker: Halsin
54.text: And I truly mean we. Every moment counts, and I've asked much of you already without being at your side.
54.context: NodeContext: Urgent/motivated. A chance to lift the curse might be at hand

2.speaker: Player
2.text: I need you to remain at camp for now.

90.speaker: Player
90.context: NodeContext: Concerned/Urgent. The curse will not be lifted unless a spirit of the land is fully restored

92.speaker: Halsin
92.text: Perhaps - if we can find Thaniel's lost half, and make him whole again.
92.context: NodeContext: Concerned/Urgent. The curse will not be lifted unless a spirit of the land is fully restored

5.speaker: Player
5.context: NodeContext: Concerned/Urgent. The curse will not be lifted unless a spirit of the land is fully restored

10.speaker: Halsin
10.text: I knew something was wrong when he didn't wake up, but now I'm even more certain.
10.context: NodeContext: Concerned/Urgent. The curse will not be lifted unless a spirit of the land is fully restored

85.speaker: Halsin
85.text: By now, we should have seen some small glimmer of Thaniel's power - a sign that the land is healing. New growth, flowers in bloom. But there has been nothing.
85.context: NodeContext: Concerned/Urgent. The curse will not be lifted unless a spirit of the land is fully restored
